s.text: On Tuesday, the paper's lead story suggested that $1 billion in foreign aid had been stolen in Bosnia.
The Los Angeles Times goes with a local story on a national issue: The state assembly approved a ban on "unsafe" handguns, making California the second state to do so (after Massachusetts).
At a press conference on Wednesday, a State Department spokesman said the story was misleading.
The guns are considered unsafe if they do not meet standards designed to prevent misfiring.
The Post says in its headline that both groups have been losing members, but the NYT emphasizes cost-cutting needs: The churches can now combine resources and clergy in cash-strapped areas.
History textbook or today's front page?
